attributes.action: RSPCA vehicles to have some type of emergency lighting
attributes.background: RSPCA vehicles need to have some type of emergency lighting because pets mean the world to someone like everyone else, and animals need help quickly too and they can't get to places during rush hour traffic so its life or death for an animal

attributes.action: Guarantee the estimated £3.8 million of HLS funding for the New Forest.
attributes.background:
There will be a £3.8 million gap in funding for the New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme for 2019 and 2020 once the UK officially leaves the EU.

The scheme is vital to protecting the New Forest's unique environment. That's why we're calling on the government to continue funding the scheme.
attributes.additional_details:
The New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme is a formal partnership between the Verderers, the Forestry Commission and the New Forest National Park Authority.

It has:
Restored miles of internationally-important habitats for wildlife
Supported the historic practice of commoning, which maintains the unique Forest landscape
Worked to identify & protect historic sites

New Forest Commoners: http://www.nfcda.com/news--meetings.html
Official page: http://www.hlsnewforest.org.uk/hls/site/index.php

attributes.action: Sue the EU via the ECJ for the monies the UK should of had under our old rebate
attributes.background: In 2005, Blair gave up 40% of the UK rebate in return for future reforms of the EU. Since those reforms were never made - we should be refunded the money. Full transcripts of those meetings should be made public to ensure the EU did not persuade blair by offering him help with an EU presidency bid
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/6516753/Tony-Blairs-decision-to-cut-the-EU-rebate-cost-9.3billion-report-shows.html

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://forbritain.org/140518_eu_rebate_blair.pdf&ved=0ahUKEwjph9Wk7OfNAhVkJcAKHaF9Cd8QFggjMAI&usg=AFQjCNFmtmQSYDDg_kKTb48fcQY19PZ5ow&sig2=WGvOnpdL7aT0BjfKUkL4zw

attributes.action: Change the law on combustion engine assisted push bicycles
attributes.background: In the UK it is the law to register, MOT, tax and insure a push bike with a combustion engine on. There are many kits available to fit to your push bike that range up to 80cc. In many countries they are exempt from registration and insurance with success and I think that the same should apply here.
attributes.additional_details: In countries such as Australia it is almost encouraged to use these vehicles as an alternative to cars. They are easy to use, build and repair, are very economical and cause less pollution than a single person travelling in a car. I believe that similar laws should be in place here to allow oppertunities for people who may not be able to afford or run a car or who wish to choose alternative transport. They will help to reduce city traffic and emissions and help to keep roads clearer.

attributes.action: Companies should have a tax contribution symbol indicating how much tax they pay
attributes.background: Companies should have a simple to understand visual indicator such as an emoji to tell consumers how much tax they contribute as compared to revenue and how much their ceo is paid in comparison to the income of workers and company revenue/growth.

attributes.action: Make MPs promise to protect certain EU legislation, including workers' rights.
attributes.background: I have never been a fan of the EU. As has been pointed out numerous times it is bureaucratic and its organisation has many flaws. That said I voted to remain because being a member has made the UK a better, fairer country. I fear this being undone and the country going backwards, not forwards.
attributes.additional_details:
17,410,742 people voted to leave the EU in the referendum, but 16,141,241 voted to stay. If slightly over 630,000 had voted differently the remain campaign would have won the vote. Though the wishes of the majority must be accepted, it would be intolerable to ignore the wishes of the remain voters.

If the UK wishes to be an outward looking nation then a public statement must be made by MPs from all parties that EU legislation regarding workers' rights and the environment will be protected.

attributes.action: Declare Richmond park in London, car free Zone
attributes.background:
One of the very few places in London, where Londoners and visitors can enjoy, walking, cycling and generally being close to nature without having to leave London. 

The experience, however, is very much spoiled by increased risk of accidents due to huge number of cars driving around the park.
attributes.additional_details: Declare Richmond park in London, car free Zone. If this is not possible, the park should be car-free at the weekends.

attributes.action: Conduct an Independence referendum for Scotland,Wales and Northern Ireland
attributes.background: We the people living in the UK under HM's government rule after voting on EU regarding referendum demand an Independence referendum for the states of Wales,Scotland and Northern Ireland.People should have the right of such a referendum because after Brexit vote opinions of people are changed.

attributes.action: To force councils to invest revenue from parking fines into parking facilities
attributes.background: It is a well known fact that parking fines generate huge profits for local councils, c.£600million+, but there is no action or interest in reducing the number of parking fines issued to motorists, as this is viewed as a profit generator for all local councils alike
attributes.additional_details:
Councils should be forced to invest the large majority of these funds into parking solutions/facilities i.e. underground car parks in densely populated cities and towns, or road improvements where parking improvements are not feasible.

Any improvements should reflect the requirement for resident, business and visitor parking.

attributes.action: Cap private renting to affordable prices for working families
attributes.background: Private renting in the UK is at an all time high increased far more than wages and families are struggling to make ends meet because of over priced private properties to rent. The government should set out new legislation for landlords to abide by.

attributes.action: Make CBD available on the NHS to children suffering dravet syndrome.
attributes.background: Dravet syndrome is a severe and intractable epilepsy. there is a growing interest among families, physicians and the medical community in the use of cannabidiol (CBD) for the treatment of Dravet syndrome. CBD is one of more than 60 cannabinoids in the marijuana plant. CBD is not psychoactive.

attributes.action: Ensure the Health Secretary is a qualified doctor of medicine.
attributes.background: The current health secretary has no medical experience, which is illogical with regards to the responsibility involved in such a job. He is also known to have supported medical practices with no scientific basis. This highlights clear problems with the way in which the health secretary is appointed.

attributes.action: Stop bonfires, during the hours of daylight, in residential areas.
attributes.background: I live in an area with large gardens but neighbours frequently have bonfires during daylight hours. Smoke never blows into their garden! Gardens should be enjoyed and relaxing but this is impossible with smoke making you choke. If they waited until after dark, then no-one would be affected by it.

attributes.action: Ban redoing referendums
attributes.background: We should not redo referendums

attributes.action: Vote registration system to validate UK citizenship prior to issuing ballot card
attributes.background: Many people unelligable to vote because they are not UK citizens are illegally registering to vote in UK ballots because there are insufficient background checks on nationality. In particular this was highlighted in the EU referendum, where non-UK citizens were voting to remain.
attributes.additional_details:
Background checks on citizenship must be applied prior to registration acceptance to prevent electoral fraud. 

Where people do commit fraud in elections there needs to be a mechanism for criminal prosecution, rigorously followed through by the police and courts.

attributes.action: Allow the alternative vote in the next General Election
attributes.background: With the current state of the country and the government in turmoil a General Election looks likely. We demand it incorporates the alternative vote system in order to encourage a fairer outcome for all political parties and allow voters to adequately portray their political views.

attributes.action: Seize this opportunity to reform the EU by offering an alternative system.
attributes.background: Across Europe much dissatisfaction is being heard, with membership referenda being called for in many other countries. We have the world's best diplomats. This is an opportunity for us to seize the initiative in constructing a Europe Mk II that  recognises sovereignty but encourages free trade.

attributes.action: We must have a 2nd EU Referendum: Vote restricted to those aged 16 to 50 years.
attributes.background: The result of the first referendum is essentially a tie.  The result of the first referendum is made null and void by the deliberate misinformation and lies of both the Leave and Remain campaigns.  The first referendum failed to recognise that the primary stakeholders are the young and not the old.
attributes.additional_details: The political elite and the political media have entirely failed the British people. The 2nd referendum should only take place once a mechanism has been devised to moderate the arguments put forward by the Remain and Leave campaigns.  At the very least, arguments would require references which support the argument, in a similar way to academic papers being considered for publication in a journal.

attributes.action:
Reopen negotiations with EU to agree better terms for UK.
Hold 2nd referendum.
attributes.background:
The EU Referendum was based upon the last negotiations, which failed to satisfy the majority of voters.
Nevertheless, so momentous is the decision, the U.K. population deserve the opportunity to reconsider a further, more favourable, revision of our terms of membership in a 2nd referendum.

attributes.action: Allow Norwich South to have a referendum to become independent from the UK
attributes.background: Norwich South voted to remain in the EU, the only remain constitiency in Norfolk. We shouldn't have to be taken out of the EU against our own will. If we are to remain in the UK then the Golden Triangle shall revolt!
attributes.additional_details: Norwich South was the only place in Norfolk to vote to remain in the EU, one of five in East Anglia.

attributes.action: As law all convicted racists must integrate with whom they discriminate against
attributes.background: Instead of a slap on the wrist show them the people they are discriminating against, in a community service like format make them for example: go to mosque or church and go to community gatherings for an alotted ammount of hours

attributes.action: Take actions to eliminate bullying to teenage boys that enjoy Performing Arts.
attributes.background:
I'm a young boy and I really like dance - so much, that I would like to do it as a career. But unfortunately this isn't an easy thing to do - lots of homophobic bullying is involved. This shouldn't be tolerated. Boys and girls are equal - and so should be treated as so.
FACE THE FACTS, BOYS DANCE!

attributes.action: Add political history and international relations to the school curriculum.
attributes.background: A small number of people knew about how a democracy works at the end of the EU referendum. Even fewer understood what benefits the eu gave and the cost of having it. By adding how Britain creates and maintains relationships and political ideologies to the curriculum we should increase that number.
attributes.additional_details: I think evidence for the need for politics to be added is the large number of people asking for a second referendum because it didn't go their way. These people clearly do not know how a democracy works and they should. There also needs to be teaching into the benefits of international relations and the benefits each nation gives to the UK as well as how those relationships are formed and maintained.I propose they are added into PSHE lessons before the end of formal secondary education at 16.

attributes.action:
-Extend EU exit interim period to 5years.
-Final Decision Referendum in Year 5.
attributes.background: The EU referendum was too close to be conclusive, and the future of the UK too uncertain to leave the EU in 2 years. We the undersigned request that the interim exit period be extended to 5 years with a Final Decision Referendum taking place in Year 5. We do not want this http://bit.ly/28TVrjb

attributes.action: Require a new referendum on EU with minimum 5% majority to be valid.
attributes.background: With new facts that have come to light, so many people voting based in mis-information and lack of detail, and the divided country we now live in, we want a new referendum on leaving the EU with a clear 5% majority. It's too an important decision to accept a 2% lead and a divided country.

attributes.action: To implement a national standard for the design of cycle lanes by cyclists.
attributes.background: A lot of money has been spent recently on local cycle schemes that have been very poorly implimented; therefore not having the desired effect and in some places making the roads more dangerous for all road users. I believe there should be a national standard for the design of cycle routes and paths.
attributes.additional_details:
£29 million cycle route with very poor sections - http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/news/design-of-flagship-29m-leeds-to-bradford-cycle-superhighway-will-set-cycling-back-1-7916928
Some photos of poorly placed cycle lanes -https://www.theguardian.com/environment/gallery/2009/nov/05/readers-worst-cycle-https://www.buzzfeed.com/jonstone/22-london-cycle-lanes-that-hate-cyclists?utm_term=.fee8zBePA#.qta6MxrlB

attributes.action: Ban, for at least one year, petitions on the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Rerunning debates in Parliament that have been discussed ad nauseum takes up the valuable time of MPs. The country needs to settle after a protracted build up to the recent EU referendum. Forcing further debate in Parliament is negative.

attributes.action: Give Scotland a referendum with option for independence ONLY if UK leaves EU
attributes.background: Many people in Scotland only want independence because the UK is leaving the EU and should be given this explicit option. If results of this referendum show that leaving the EU will lead to breakup of the UK, there should be another UK referendum on leaving EU as leave voters did not know this.
attributes.additional_details: Following the EU leave vote, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon is seeking an independence referendum on grounds that Scottish people do not want to leave EU. However leave voters did not know that Scottish independence was a consequence of their vote. The fairest way to address this is to urgently hold a Scottish referendum which would be binding only if UK continues to leave EU. Then UK should be given second referendum in full knowledge of the consequences of leaving EU.

attributes.action: Give free British citizenship to EU immigrants working in the UK over 5 years.
attributes.background: The U.K. is demonstrating a hostile feeling towards all immigrants.And now we are a population that feel openly ostracised,voiceless,discriminated against and unwelcome. We need clear evidence that we are wanted and welcome in this country and proof that we are an integral part of the U.K.'s future.
attributes.additional_details: The leaders of this country have a lot to answer to Immigrants for now.What's in it for us now that we are out of the EU and living in the UK? Besides xenophobia and ostracisation? What certainties are there for immigrants' future as members of this society and how are we clearly a part of the strategy for a United Kingdom that no longer abides by the laws and regulations of the EU. Giving us British citizenship will be the only true way immigrants will feel included and part of the U.K. again.
attributes.creator_name: Vasco Sérgio Rodrigues Gaspar de Almeida Santos

attributes.action: Increased court powers and sentences for racially motivated attacks.
attributes.background: In the wake of the referendum, there have been massively increased reports of racially motivated attacks on foreign born nationals and Muslims. We need much tougher sentences to stop this from becoming the norm.

attributes.action: Renegotiate a better deal with the EU before a 2nd referendum
attributes.background: The Government should return to the negotiating table with the EU to attempt to secure a better deal for the UK to remain, acceptable to the British public, which could then be offered to the British people in a 2nd referendum BEFORE Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty is invoked.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron negotiated the deal with the EU from a position of weakness, by declaring beforehand that he wanted to remain. The referendum result has resulted in a general acceptance within the EU that change is needed. Now that it is clear to Europe that we WILL leave under the present conditions, we should offer the EU a 2nd referendum IF AND ONLY IF a more acceptable deal, addressing voters key concerns over immigration, can be offered to the British Electorate.

attributes.action: Parliament must not recess until there is a  ratified plan post-referendum
attributes.background: The electorate needs leadership and understanding. Parliament must sit until this is achieved. All facts and assertions must be independently verified and it must be a contempt of Parliament to knowingly supply, support or provide inaccurate or misleading information.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is in danger of disintegration. Leadership is needed.

attributes.action: A UK Bill of Rights should be introduced as the country leaves the EU.
attributes.background: With the outcome of the UK Referendum now known, many people are concerned about losing the protection of ECHR. A Bill of Rights to protect and enhance our freedoms is a clear statement of our country's commitment to these principles. It should be introduced to coincide with our exit from the Union.

attributes.action: Independence For The South West Of England Creating The Kingdom Of Wessex.
attributes.background: I am sick of politicians In London letting the South West Rot, Not providing enough money for better education, updating infrastructure and stimulating enough jobs or housing for the people like me who was born in the South West and will die in the South West. Now it is time for Independence.
attributes.additional_details: 1) We need updated High speed rail Infrastructure but the government won't spend a penny because we are not worth it despite Devon alone creating over £1Billion in Tourist revenue each year. We need fast and effective rail networks to keep this growing, not clapped out rickety junk. 2) Have a look around the South West town or city you live in and you can tell there is a massive lack of funding for everything. Not enough police on the streets, or enough to even investigate crime any crime.

attributes.action: Restrict petition signatories to 1 UK IP addresses ONLY to prevent further abuse
attributes.background: The petitions system is being blatantly abused by people who feel it is OK to use false data and sign a petition multiple times (and even write scripts to automate it), and that most critically non-eligible voters, outside of the UK are being allowed to steer our democratic process through fraud.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the expansion of social media, viral ideas are able to spread globally in minutes.  As we have seen in several recent petitions that have exploded overnight, that people on twitter, Facebook, 4chan, etc. are actively promoting petition fraud by having people sign using false UK addresses, and fraudulently declaring themselves to be eligible UK voters.  THIS MUST BE STOPPED.  It would be easily implemented (reduced) if Geographic IP filters are introduced, and IP addresses logged.

attributes.action: Offer all pro-EU British citizens a grant to relocate to Europe.
attributes.background: Any current British citizen not wanting to live under UK governance should be offered a grant to relocate to an EU country. By doing so they forfeit forever all privileges afforded by the UK - such as free health care, pensions, disability benefits, social housing etc.

attributes.action: If MP's veto EU referendum result a General Election must be called.
attributes.background:
Some MP's from the Remain camp of the recent EU referendum, such as David Lammy, are suggesting that MP's should not vote through the result in parliament. 
If this is the case then all MP's should know that they are accountable to the public and a General Election be called immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
When the MP's are asked to vote whether to vote through the referendum result or not, then this should be a public ballot and not a secret ballot. 
This will ensure that the nation have the perfect opportunity to vote out, if they so wish, any MP's that have decided that democracy is only preferable when it is on their own terms.

attributes.action: Stop all future referendums from July 2016
attributes.background: Referendums cause division, animosity and pull the country apart.

attributes.action: Extend existing points immigration rules to non-Common Travel Area nationals
attributes.background: We petition parliament to extend the points based immigration system that applies to non-EU nationals to the citizens of countries outside the Common Travel Area, and make necessary adjustments to the points requirements to ensure an adequate supply of labour to the various sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Common travel area: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/common-travel-area-cta/common-travel-area-cta

Immigration rules that apply to non-EU citizens: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-index

attributes.action: Make it law that a 2nd referendum cant be called for 20 years after the 1st.
attributes.background: To protect the democratic purpose of a refurendum a 2nd should not be held just because people disagree with the outcome. Having the law would mean people are fully aware of the consequences of voting in the first place. Its unfair for people to cast a vote then have to worry it could be overturned
attributes.additional_details: 2014 scottish independance from the UK referendum & 2016 UK membership of the EU referendum. These are two examples where calls for a 2nd referendum should be cancelled out by law, the decision has been made and should be respected.

attributes.action: Increase the HM Government Petition Response and Action Commitment
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to recognise the scale of opinion over lawful and reasonable public interest matters with the provision of additional petition signature number milestones.
attributes.additional_details: It is proposed that a parliamentary debate is held for petitions achieving 1 million signatures and positive change is instigated for petitions achieving 10 million signatures.

attributes.action: Make voting eligible to only those who have paid PAYE tax for 5 or more years
attributes.background: Due to the backlash from the EU referendum from individuals who have no interest in what happens to the ordinary citizen and big businesses who are only interested in lining their pockets, we wish there to restrictions where only those who have paid into the country may vote for it's future.

attributes.action: Allow the youth (14-17) to vote in larger elections/referendums
attributes.background:
Big decisions affects them as well, and their future should be the prime concern at the heart of future referendums. 
At the end of the day it is there futures on the line and it would be selfish to deny them a vote.
not letting them vote would be scandalous and would cause outrage among them.
attributes.additional_details:
This is backed up by the fact that YouGov's statistics said 18-24 year olds mostly voted to remain. 
Young people are also told to voice their opinion and this would help them alot, whilst also introducing them to politics and wanting to contribute to society.

attributes.action: Make York a union with London to remain in the EU
attributes.background: York voted to remain in the EU by 58%. This is the historical capital of the North of England and was the second city until the industrial revolution. York can develop a second financial and political centre and should join London to stay in the EU.

attributes.action: Make voting be required by law from the age of 16
attributes.background: Turnouts in elections/referendums can be low meaning there are people out there not represented by the governments we elect or by the choices made in referendums - make voting be required by law, where if you don't vote you are fined (unless exceptional circumstances) and lower the voting age to 16

attributes.action: Call for a referendum in N.Ireland to decide if it remains part of the UK
attributes.background: The people of Northern Ireland have clearly decided that they want to remain a part of the European Union. Nigel Farage has lied to us, we want justice. We, the people of Northern Ireland, want to be freed. We ask that we can be allowed a referendum on the basis of our vote on the EU referendum.

attributes.action: Do not allow a second referendum on the EU to take place within the next 5 years
attributes.background: The nation has spoken and the result has been determined. Let's not change the rules after the fact.

attributes.action: Enact legislation to match EU funding for areas defined as Economically Deprived
attributes.background: Legislate guaranteeing to match (and increase in line with the Retail Price Index) current EU funding for areas defined using the EU model as Economically Deprived, post exit from the EU in 2018. This to be in addition to current levels of government investment in such areas and not replacing it.
attributes.additional_details:
This is to ensure financial promises made during the Leave campaign are not forgotten and to maintain investment and growth for the populations of such Economically Deprived areas.
E.g. The total European Regional Development Fund for the 2014-2020 funding period is €3.6bn.

attributes.action: Consider The City Of London as a free independent state. Remaining in the EU
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum decision and rumours of Scotland and Ireland. The United Kingdom has become more divided than ever. It is time for London to stand alone. We ask that the government consider the feasibility of London standing alone and remaining in the EU

attributes.action: Compulsory Voting Onile for all above the age of 14
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule for all future referendum that voting is made compulsory for all above the age of 14 and is conducted online.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the criticality of the recent referendum the whole of the population was not represented particularly the young teenagers who are to live with this desicion for the rest of their lives. Online voting would be appealing to the young generation and would keep costs to a minimum in times of austerity.
